title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: Basic Example  course, mapping argument fill drive category filling color.  course, can choose, customize categories labels setting axis.text theme_*() function. need can come add labels series circles ending positions. comes geom_series_text() functions.  can set init_angle define fragment circle starting angle. Two series circles combination
code: library(tidyverse) library(ggtricks) prod_df <- data.frame(   good = c("Chicken", "Eggs", "Meats"),    inflation = c(2.275, 8.5, 3.85) )  prod_df <- prod_df |>    mutate(good = fct_reorder(good, inflation))  prod_df |>   ggplot() +    geom_series_circles(aes(inflation, good), color = "white", linewidth = 2.5) +    coord_equal() +    theme_minimal() prod_df |>   ggplot() +    geom_series_circles(aes(inflation, good, fill = good),color = "black", linewidth = 2.5) +    coord_equal() +    theme_minimal() prod_df |>   ggplot() +    geom_series_circles(aes(inflation, good, fill = good),color = "black", linewdith = 2.5) +    geom_series_text(aes(inflation, good, label = inflation)) +    coord_equal() +    theme_minimal() index_df <- tribble(    ~article, ~index,    "Plate beef", 187,    "Bacon", 215,    "Lard", 266   )  index_df <- index_df |>    mutate(     index =  index / 100   )  index_df |>    ggplot() +    geom_series_circles(aes(index, article),                       init_angle = 45                       # init_angle = 90                       # init_angle = 145                       # init_angle = 180                       ) +    coord_equal() +   theme_minimal()

code: my_df <- data.frame(   cat = paste0("Prod ",  1:4),     val = c( 87,34,21,8) )  categories_fills <- c(   "Prod 1" = "#3E71EC",   "Prod 2" = "#A9A9A9",   "Prod 3" = "#7942A6",   "Prod 4" = "#F7324B" ) my_df |>   ggplot() +    geom_pie(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),              init_angle = 0             # init_angle = 60,             # init_angle = 120,             # init_angle = 180            ) +    coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills   ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>   ggplot() +    geom_pie(aes(cat = cat, val = val), spotlight_max = TRUE,            spotlight_position = "top",            # spotlight_position = "right"            # spotlight_position = "bottom"            # spotlight_position = "left"   ) +    coord_equal() +    scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills   ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>     ggplot() +    geom_pie(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),            spotlight_cat = "Prod 1",            spotlight_position = "top"            ) +   coord_equal() +     scale_fill_manual(       values = categories_fills,        guide = "none"     ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>    ggplot() +    geom_pie(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat, label = cat)            # labels_with_ticks = TRUE            ) +    coord_equal() +     scale_fill_manual(       values = categories_fills,        guide = "none"     ) +   theme_minimal()
